item.title: 引发得克萨斯州致命洪灾的关键天气因素
item.description:
气候变化带来的大气环境助长了极端降雨，再加上干旱贫瘠的土壤和炎热的墨西哥湾，这一切都助长了灾难的发生。【原文：

An atmosphere that climate change has primed for extreme rainfall coupled with drought-parched soil and a hot Gulf of Mexico helped drive disaster.

】

item.title: 加州消防员控制了 40% 的年度最大火灾
item.description: 加利福尼亚州消防员在控制一场野火方面取得了进展，这场野火在周末假期爆发，成为该州今年最大的野火。【原文：California firefighters made progress in containing a wildfire that exploded over the holiday weekend to become the state’s largest of the year.】

item.title: 特朗普计划本周出访得克萨斯州考察洪灾破坏情况
item.description: 白宫表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普本周将前往得克萨斯州，亲自考察特大洪灾造成的破坏情况，洪灾已造成至少 91 人死亡，数十人失踪。【原文：President Donald Trump will travel to Texas this week to survey first-hand the devastation from extreme floods that have left at least 91 people dead and scores still missing, the White House said.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州致命洪灾后，关于云播种的错误信息甚嚣尘上
item.description:
尽管所有气象学证据都表明该技术并未导致极端降雨，但阴谋论者却散布了这一被推翻的观点。【原文：

While all meteorological evidence shows the technology didn’t cause the extreme rainfall, conspiracy theorists have spread the debunked idea.

】

item.title: 特朗普对可再生能源嗤之以鼻，美国警告杀煤将带来停电风险
item.description: 根据特朗普政府的一份报告，由于人工智能带来的电力需求预期增长，到 2030 年美国的停电事故可能会增加一倍，该报告将预期的能源短缺归咎于煤炭和天然气发电厂的关闭以及对可再生能源的过度依赖。【原文：Blackouts in the US could double by 2030 amid an expected increase in power demand brought on by AI, according to a Trump administration report that blames the expected energy shortfall on the closures of coal and natural gas power plants and overreliance on renewable energy.】

item.title: 欧盟国家呼吁简化和延迟森林砍伐规则
item.description: 几个欧盟成员国正在要求欧盟行政部门进一步简化和推迟实施旨在遏制全球森林砍伐的规则，以便为更多遵守规则的国家减少繁文缛节。【原文：Several European Union members are asking the bloc’s executive to further simplify and delay the application of rules aimed at curbing global deforestation to reduce red tape for more compliant nations.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州应对更多暴雨，洪灾死亡人数攀升
item.description: 德克萨斯州中部的暴雨又将持续一天，这使得该地区在特大洪灾造成至少 82 人死亡和数十人失踪之后的救援工作变得更加复杂。【原文：Downpours will sweep central Texas for another day, complicating rescue efforts after extreme flooding in the region left at least 82 people dead and scores missing.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州灾难敲响气候就绪的警钟
item.description: 今天的时事通讯带来了来自得克萨斯州的最新消息，暴雨引发的灾难性洪灾已造成至少 82 人死亡，多人失踪，其中包括儿童。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读更多相关报道和全天更新。【原文：Today’s newsletter brings the latest news from Texas, where a catastrophic flood caused by torrential rains has resulted in at least 82 deaths and many missing, including children. You can read more on this story with updates throughout the day on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 野火烟雾给北极带来被遗忘的危险：黑碳
item.description:
科学家们正在修正他们对烟尘可能对冰川和冰盖造成危害的看法。【原文：

Scientists are revising their view of the role that soot may play in endangering glaciers and ice sheets.

】

item.title: 欧洲大陆炙烤下的欧盟损失
item.description:
欧洲的绿色雄心在高温下逐渐枯萎。【原文：

Europe’s green ambition is wilting in the heat.

】

item.title: Hive Hydrogen 为价值 58 亿美元的南非工厂征集建议书
item.description: 南非 Hive Hydrogen 公司表示，该公司正在寻求工程公司的建议，以开发其计划在南非东开普省投资 58 亿美元的绿色氢气项目。【原文：Hive Hydrogen South Africa said it’s seeking proposals from engineering companies to develop the $5.8 billion green hydrogen project it’s planning in the country’s Eastern Cape province.】

item.title: 小米创始人对电动汽车的大胆押注正在苹果失败的地方得到回报
item.description: 小米公司是唯一一家成功涉足汽车制造领域的科技公司，其创始人兼董事长雷军对此无法抗拒。【原文：Lei Jun, founder and chairman of Xiaomi Corp., the only tech company to have successfully diversified into carmaking, couldn’t resist.】

item.title: 致命洪灾加剧了得克萨斯州作为危机中心所面临的挑战
item.description: 星期五清晨，天还没亮，道尔顿-赖斯（Dalton Rice）就沿着得克萨斯州凯尔维尔市的瓜达卢佩河慢跑起来。赖斯是一名城市经理，他在凌晨 4 点左右结束跑步时，天空下起了小雨。一小时后，他开始接到紧急电话：河水已经失控。【原文：Before dawn Friday morning, Dalton Rice went for a jog along the Guadalupe River in Kerrville, Texas. Rice, the city manager, finished his run around 4 a.m. as a light rain set in. An hour later, he began receiving emergency calls: the river had flooded out of control.】

item.title: 俄罗斯报告列宁格勒乌斯季卢加海港发生氨泄漏事故
item.description: 俄罗斯报告称，列宁格勒地区的乌斯特-卢加海港发生了氨气泄漏，当局称是在 Eco Wizard 号液化石油气油轮的装载作业中发生的。【原文：Russia reported an ammonia leak at the Ust-Luga seaport in the Leningrad region that authorities said occurred during loading operations on the LPG tanker Eco Wizard.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州洪灾死亡人数上升，继续搜寻失踪露营者
item.description: 德克萨斯州山区发生特大洪灾后，已造成至少 43 人死亡，数十名儿童失踪，官员警告说，由于天气预报称未来几天将有更多降雨和山洪暴发的风险，伤亡人数还将攀升。【原文：At least 43 people have died and dozens of children are missing in the Texas Hill Country after catastrophic flooding, with officials warning the casualty count will climb as forecasts call for more rain and the risk of further flash floods in the coming days.】

item.title: 美国最致命洪灾一览
item.description: 根据美国国家气象局的数据，在过去几十年中，洪水每年平均造成超过 125 人死亡，而山洪暴发则是美国与暴风雨相关的头号杀手。【原文：Flooding has caused an average of more than 125 deaths per year in the United States over the past few decades, according to the National Weather Service, and flash floods are the nation’s top storm-related killer.】

item.title: 热带风暴 "香塔尔 "在卡罗莱纳州沿海形成
item.description: 迈阿密（美联社）— 热带风暴 "香塔尔 "已在美国东南沿海形成。位于米亚米亚的国家飓风中心（National Hurricane Center）称，卡罗莱纳州部分地区已发布热带风暴警报。预计周六晚些时候受影响地区将出现热带风暴天气。【原文：MIAMI (AP) — Tropical Storm Chantal has formed off the southeast U.S. coast. The National Hurricane Center in Miamia says tropical storm warnings have been issued for portions of the Carolinas. Tropical storm conditions are expected in the affected areas later Saturday.】

item.title: 幽灵工厂是绿色制造未来的警示信号
item.description:
随着项目取消数量的增加，特朗普税收法案中对清洁能源抵免额度的削减加剧了该行业面临的挑战。【原文：

Rollbacks of clean-energy credits in Trump’s tax bill add to the sector’s challenges as project cancellations rise. 

】

item.title: 法国电力集团（EDF）将法国海上风电场的启动时间推迟两年，以应对施工挑战
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）目前预计，诺曼底沿岸在建的一座法国海上风电场将于 2027 年完工，比原计划晚两年，原因是一家主要承包商的地基工程出现延误。【原文：Electricite de France SA now expects a French offshore wind farm under construction off the Normandy coast to be completed in 2027, two years later than previously planned, due to delays in foundation work by a key contractor.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州洪灾造成至少 13 人死亡；夏令营儿童失踪
item.description: 在得克萨斯州发生的灾难性洪灾已造成至少 13 人死亡，数十人失踪，官员们警告说，未来几天将有更多降雨，并有可能发生更多山洪。【原文：At least 13 people have died and dozens are missing after catastrophic flooding in Texas, with officials warning of more rain and the risk of further flash floods in the coming days.】

item.title: 洪灾过后，得克萨斯州夏令营有 20 多名女孩失踪
item.description: 周五，洪水肆虐德克萨斯州中南部地区，一个女子夏令营的 20 多名营员下落不明，德克萨斯州的父母们疯狂地在社交媒体上发布小女儿的照片，并请求提供相关信息。【原文：Texas parents frantically posted photos of their young daughters on social media with pleas for information as more than 20 campers from an all-girls summer camp were unaccounted for Friday after floods tore through the state's south-central region.】

item.title: 声明草案显示金砖国家将谴责 "胁迫性 "关税
item.description: 金砖国家领导人准备在贸易关税、中东冲突和应对气候变化的必要性等问题上采取与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普相左的立场。【原文：BRICS leaders are poised to adopt a position at odds with US President Donald Trump on trade tariffs, aspects of conflict in the Middle East and the need to tackle climate change.】

item.title: 破坏者和维护失误导致约翰内斯堡大片地区干涸
item.description: 自上月下旬以来，南非最大城市约翰内斯堡的大部分地区一直处于停水状态，原因是水库正在努力从定期维护中恢复过来，而且犯罪分子还破坏了一条重要的输水管道。【原文：Large parts of Johannesburg, South Africa’s biggest city, have been without water since late last month as reservoirs struggle to recover from scheduled maintenance and after criminals vandalized a key pipeline.】

item.title: 美国退出，最大气候基金批准创纪录拨款
item.description: 世界上最大的气候基金表示，在美国撤回向该组织承诺的 40 亿美元的一年里，该基金批准了创纪录的项目拨款。【原文：The world’s biggest climate fund said it approved record allocations for projects in a year when the US pulled $4 billion it had pledged to the organization.】

item.title: 热浪袭击欧洲，德国高速公路出现裂缝
item.description: 德国将于本周末对其高速公路进行紧急维修，因为最近几天的极端高温天气炸毁了高速公路主要路段的大块混凝土。【原文：Germany will carry out emergency repairs on its autobahn this weekend after extreme heat in recent days blew up large chunks of concrete along key stretches of the highway.】

item.title: 酷热天气东移，希腊和土耳其被炙热高温灼伤
item.description: 周五，强烈的热浪继续炙烤着欧洲，消防员们争分夺秒地控制着希腊和邻国土耳其的野火。【原文：An intense heat wave continued to scorch Europe on Friday as firefighters scrambled to control wildfires in Greece and neighboring Turkey.】

item.title: 日本 1.7 万亿美元基金增持 ESG 股票，其他基金纷纷出逃
item.description: 日本 1.7 万亿美元的政府养老金投资基金（Government Pension Investment Fund）增加了其环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）投资，拒绝许多全球资产管理公司放弃绿色战略的做法。【原文：Japan’s $1.7 trillion Government Pension Investment Fund has added to its ESG investments, rejecting the shift away from green strategies by many global asset managers.】

item.title: 欧洲央行警告热浪对通胀和经济增长的影响
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员弗兰克-埃尔德森认为，热量与通货膨胀和国内生产总值等关键经济指标之间的联系非常重要，不容忽视。【原文：The link between heat and key economic indicators such as inflation and gross domestic product is too important to ignore, according to European Central Bank Executive Board member Frank Elderson.】

item.title: 取消税收减免对电动汽车市场意味着什么？
item.description:
由于各州和经销商推出了一系列新车型和优惠措施，销量可能会低于预期，但不会完全跌至谷底。【原文：

Sales are likely to dip below forecasts but not completely bottom out thanks to an array of new models and incentives from states and dealers. 

】

item.title: 在加利福尼亚，支持住房 "富足 "的粉丝们改写了一个环境里程碑
item.description:
一些环保人士对州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）取消住房和先进制造业反污染法律的举措表示赞赏。其他人则感到震惊。【原文：

Some environmentalists applaud Governor Gavin Newsom’s move to roll back anti-pollution laws for housing and advanced manufacturing. Others are horrified.

】
